other_tests.findings: Gallbladder is distended measuring 3.8 cm in transverse and 7.9 cm in craniocaudal dimension with gallbladder wall edema and probable trace pericholecystic fluid. No gallstones present. Kidneys have hypodensities likely representing simple cysts. A hypodense lesion in the left lobe of the liver suggests a hemangioma.
